verses.verse: Now the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had said <S%H559><s%> to Abram <S%H87><s%>, Get out <S%H3212><s%> of your country <S%H776><s%>, and from your relatives <S%H4138><s%>, and from your father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, to a land <S%H776><s%> that I will show you <S%H7200><s%>:

And I will make of you <S%H6213><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> nation <S%H1471><s%>, and I will bless <S%H1288><s%> you <S%H1431><s%>, and make your name <S%H8034><s%> great <S%H1431><s%>; and you shall be a blessing <S%H1293><s%>:

And I will bless <S%H1288><s%> them that bless <S%H1288><s%> you <S%H779><s%>, and curse him that curses <S%H7043><s%> you <S%H4940><s%>: and in you shall all families of the earth <S%H127><s%> be blessed <S%H1288><s%>.

So Abram <S%H87><s%> departed <S%H3212><s%>, as the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had spoken <S%H1696><s%> to him <S%H3876><s%>; and Lot went <S%H3212><s%> with him <S%H87><s%>: and Abram was seventy <S%H7657><s%> and five <S%H2568><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he departed <S%H3318><s%> out of Haran <S%H2771><s%>.

And Abram <S%H87><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> Sarai <S%H8297><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%>, and Lot <S%H3876><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%>'s son <S%H1121><s%>, and all their substance <S%H7399><s%> that they had gathered <S%H7408><s%>, and the souls <S%H5315><s%> that they had gotten <S%H6213><s%> in Haran <S%H2771><s%>; and they went forth <S%H3318><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> into the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%>; and into the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> they came <S%H935><s%>.

And Abram <S%H87><s%> passed through <S%H5674><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> to the place <S%H4725><s%> of Sichem <S%H7927><s%>, to the oak <S%H436><s%> of Moreh <S%H4176><s%>. And the Canaanite <S%H3669><s%> was then <S%H227><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> appeared <S%H7200><s%> to Abram <S%H87><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, To your seed <S%H2233><s%> will I give <S%H5414><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> land <S%H776><s%>: and there built <S%H1129><s%> he an altar <S%H4196><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, who appeared to him <S%H7200><s%>.

And he removed <S%H6275><s%> from there to a mountain <S%H2022><s%> on the east <S%H6924><s%> of Beth <S%H1008><s%>–el, and pitched <S%H5186><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%>, having Beth <S%H1008><s%>–el on the west <S%H3220><s%>, and Hai <S%H5857><s%> on the east <S%H6924><s%>: and there he built <S%H1129><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and called <S%H7121><s%> upon the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>.
And Abram <S%H87><s%> journeyed <S%H5265><s%>, going on <S%H1980><s%> still <S%H5265><s%> toward the south <S%H5045><s%>.

And there was a famine <S%H7458><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>: and Abram <S%H87><s%> went down <S%H3381><s%> into Egypt <S%H4714><s%> to stay <S%H1481><s%> there <S%H7458><s%>; for the famine was severe <S%H3515><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H834><s%>, when he was come near <S%H7126><s%> to enter <S%H935><s%> into Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, that he said <S%H559><s%> to Sarai <S%H8297><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%>, Behold <S%H2009><s%> now <S%H4994><s%>, I know <S%H3045><s%> that you are a fair <S%H3303><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> to look upon <S%H4758><s%>:

Therefore it shall come to pass <S%H4713><s%>, when the Egyptians shall see <S%H7200><s%> you <S%H559><s%>, that they shall say, This is his wife <S%H802><s%>: and they will kill <S%H2026><s%> me <S%H2421><s%>, but they will save you alive.

Say <S%H559><s%>, I pray you <S%H4994><s%>, you are my sister <S%H269><s%>: that <S%H4616><s%> it may be well <S%H3190><s%> with me for your sake <S%H5315><s%>; and my soul shall live <S%H2421><s%> because of you <S%H1558><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H87><s%>, that, when Abram was come <S%H935><s%> into Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, the Egyptians <S%H4713><s%> looked <S%H7200><s%> the woman <S%H802><s%> that she was very <S%H3966><s%> fair <S%H3303><s%>.

The princes <S%H8269><s%> also of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> her <S%H1984><s%>, and praised her before <S%H413><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>: and the woman <S%H802><s%> was taken <S%H3947><s%> into Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>.

And he dealt <S%H3190><s%> Abram <S%H87><s%> well <S%H3190><s%> for her sake <S%H6629><s%>: and he had sheep, and oxen <S%H1241><s%>, and male donkeys <S%H2543><s%>, and male servants <S%H5650><s%>, and female servants <S%H8198><s%>, and female donkeys <S%H860><s%>, and camels <S%H1581><s%>.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> plagued <S%H5060><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> and his house <S%H1004><s%> with great <S%H1419><s%> plagues <S%H5061><s%> because of <S%H1697><s%> Sarai <S%H8297><s%> Abram <S%H87><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%>.

And Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> Abram <S%H87><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, What is this that you have done <S%H6213><s%> to me <S%H5046><s%>? Why didn't you tell me that she was your wife <S%H802><s%>?

Why did you say <S%H559><s%>, She is my sister <S%H269><s%>? So I might have taken <S%H3947><s%> her to me to wife <S%H802><s%>: now therefore behold your wife <S%H802><s%>, take <S%H3947><s%> her <S%H3212><s%>, and go your way.
And Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> his men <S%H582><s%> concerning him <S%H7971><s%>: and they sent him away, and his wife <S%H802><s%>, and all that he had.
